duties_responsibilities.duty: Start, operate, and maintain heating and air conditioning plants and associated equipment.
Maintain and repair motor controller and associated electrical equipment.
Install, repair, and calibrate pneumatic and electric controls for temperature and humidity control equipment.
Perform inspections and repairs on equipment/systems as required by company practices and/or regulations/ordinances.
Review and interpret work orders, operating instructions, diagrams, building plans, and mechanical equipment drawings.
Work evenings, weekends, holidays, and unscheduled shifts as determined by business needs.
Climb ladders, work aloft, and move/lift items not exceeding 100 lbs.
Maintain tour hours from 8am to 5pm, Monday through Friday with varying overtime needs.

education_certification.credential: Refrigeration license and certificates for fire standpipe, sprinkler, welding, oil burner, and air compressor operation.
Universal Technician Certification as designated by EPA regulations-40 CFR Part 82 Subpart H.
